author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Updates an Amazon EKS cluster configuration. Only one type of update is allowed. Potentially harmful: once the authentication mode is updated to 'API' it is irreversible.
commands.name: aws-eks-update-cluster-config

commands.description: Lists the Amazon EKS clusters in your Amazon Web Services account in the specified Amazon Web Services Region.
commands.name: aws-eks-list-clusters

commands.description: Associates an access policy and its scope to an access entry.
commands.name: aws-eks-associate-access-policy

integration.description: The AWS EKS integration allows for the management and operation of Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) clusters.
integration.name: AWS-EKS

description: The AWS EKS integration allows for the management and operation of Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) clusters.
name: AWS - EKS
readme:
Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) is a managed service that eliminates the need to install, operate, and maintain your own Kubernetes control plane on Amazon Web Services (AWS). Kubernetes is an open-source system that automates the management, scaling, and deployment of containerized applications.

## What does this pack do
This integration enables you to:
- Retrieve the list of cluster.
- Update a cluster configuration.
- Retrieve the information of a specific cluster.
- Create a new access entry.
- Associate an access policy
- Update an access entry.
